entry.content:
A DNA-gated molecular guard controls bacterial Hailong anti-phage defence

  • Joel M. J. Tan
  • Sarah Melamed
  • Philip J. Kranzusch

entry.title: A MERS-CoV-like mink coronavirus uses ACE2 as entry receptor (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
A MERS-CoV-like mink coronavirus uses ACE2 as entry receptor

  • Ningning Wang
  • Weiwei Ji
  • Shuo Su
Article30 Apr 2025

entry.title: Metal-centred planar [15]annulenes (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Metal-centred planar [15]annulenes

An aromatic metallo-annulene, comprising a 15-carbon macrocycle enclosing an osmium complex, with the metal residing within the plane of the macrocycle is reported.

  • Binbin Xu
  • Dafa Chen
  • Haiping Xia
Article30 Apr 2025

entry.title: Adversarial testing of global neuronal workspace and integrated information theories of consciousness (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Adversarial testing of global neuronal workspace and integrated information theories of consciousness

Multimodal results (iEEG, fMRI and MEG) of predictions from integrated information theory and global neuronal workspace theory align with some predictions of both theories on visual consciousness, but also critically challenge key tenets of both theories.

  • Oscar Ferrante
  • Urszula Gorska-Klimowska
  • Lucia Melloni
ArticleOpen Access30 Apr 2025

entry.title: Diet outperforms microbial transplant to drive microbiome recovery in mice (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Diet outperforms microbial transplant to drive microbiome recovery in mice

Experiments in mouse models show that proper recovery of the intestinal microbiota following depletion, with or without faecal microbiota transplant therapy, is dependent on syntrophic interactions that occur only with specific dietary interventions.

  • M. S. Kennedy
  • A. Freiburger
  • E. B. Chang
Article30 Apr 2025

entry.title: TIR domains produce histidine-ADPR as an immune signal in bacteria (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
TIR domains produce histidine-ADPR as an immune signal in bacteria

In response to phage infection, the Toll/interleukin-1 receptor (TIR) domain protein ThsB of the type II Thoeris defence system produces histidine conjugated to ADP-ribose, which stimulates bacterial defence by interacting with the Macro domain of the ThsA membrane effector protein.

  • Dziugas Sabonis
  • Carmel Avraham
  • Giedre Tamulaitiene
Article30 Apr 2025

entry.title: Cell cycle duration determines oncogenic transformation capacity (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Cell cycle duration determines oncogenic transformation capacity

Total cell cycle duration is a key hallmark of cancer initiation, and determines whether defects in apoptosis, senescence, immune surveillance, angiogenesis, DNA repair, polarity and proliferation lead to cancer development.

  • Danian Chen
  • Suying Lu
  • Rod Bremner
ArticleOpen Access30 Apr 2025

entry.title: Structurally complex phase engineering enables hydrogen-tolerant Al alloys (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Structurally complex phase engineering enables hydrogen-tolerant Al alloys

A size-sieved complex precipitation in Sc-added Al–Mg alloys achieves a high-density dispersion of both fine Al3Sc nanoprecipitates and in situ formed core-shell Al3(Mg, Sc)2/Al3Sc nanophases with high hydrogen-trapping ability.

  • Shengyu Jiang
  • Yuantao Xu
  • Jun Sun
ArticleOpen Access30 Apr 2025

entry.title: Picuris Pueblo oral history and genomics reveal continuity in US Southwest (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Picuris Pueblo oral history and genomics reveal continuity in US Southwest

A collaborative study initiated by the sovereign nation of Picuris Pueblo in the Northern Rio Grande region of New Mexico addresses gaps in traditional knowledge and furthers understanding of their population history and ancestry.

  • Thomaz Pinotti
  • Michael A. Adler
  • Eske Willerslev
ArticleOpen Access30 Apr 2025

entry.title: Global evolution of inflammatory bowel disease across epidemiologic stages (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Global evolution of inflammatory bowel disease across epidemiologic stages

An analysis of data from 522 population-based studies encompassing 82 global regions and spanning more than a century (1920–2024) shows spatiotemporal transitions across epidemiologic stages 1 to 3 of inflammatory bowel disease, and models stage 4 progression.

  • Lindsay Hracs
  • Joseph W. Windsor
  • Gilaad G. Kaplan
ArticleOpen Access30 Apr 2025

entry.title: The distribution of subsurface microplastics in the ocean (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
The distribution of subsurface microplastics in the ocean

Global data collected between 2014 and 2024 provide insights into the distribution and potential transport mechanisms of subsurface microplastics throughout the oceanic water column.

  • Shiye Zhao
  • Karin F. Kvale
  • Aron Stubbins
AnalysisOpen Access30 Apr 2025

entry.title: Pacific hotspots reveal a Louisville–Ontong Java Nui tectonic link (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Pacific hotspots reveal a Louisville–Ontong Java Nui tectonic link

Geochemistry and geochronology show that Samoa and Rurutu–Arago are the longest-lived Pacific hotspots, providing better constraints on plate rotation and support for a link between the Louisville volcanic track and the Ontong Java Nui Plateau.

  • J. G. Konter
  • V. A. Finlayson
  • C. Kelley
Article30 Apr 2025

entry.title: Regulation of PV interneuron plasticity by neuropeptide-encoding genes (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Regulation of PV interneuron plasticity by neuropeptide-encoding genes

Increasing the activity of individual parvalbumin-expressing interneurons in the mouse brain modulates the number and strength of inhibitory parvalbumin synapses received by these cells through changes in the expression of the neuropeptide-encoding genes Vgf and Scg2.

  • Martijn Selten
  • Clémence Bernard
  • Oscar Marín
ArticleOpen Access30 Apr 2025

entry.title: Using life cycle assessment to drive innovation for sustainable cool clouds (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Using life cycle assessment to drive innovation for sustainable cool clouds

A life cycle assessment study is used to examine the impacts of advanced cooling technologies on cloud infrastructure, from virtual machines to server architecture, data centre buildings and the grid.

  • Husam Alissa
  • Teresa Nick
  • Madeline Frieze
AnalysisOpen Access30 Apr 2025

entry.title: Selective inhibition of stromal mechanosensing suppresses cardiac fibrosis (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Selective inhibition of stromal mechanosensing suppresses cardiac fibrosis

Inhibition of a cardiac stroma-enriched mechanosensor, SRC—in concert with suppression of the TGFβ pathway—potentiates the reversal of fibroblast activation and alleviates contractile dysfunction in fibrotic hearts.

  • Sangkyun Cho
  • Siyeon Rhee
  • Joseph C. Wu
Article30 Apr 2025

entry.title: Serotonin and neurotensin inputs in the vCA1 dictate opposing social valence (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Serotonin and neurotensin inputs in the vCA1 dictate opposing social valence

Aversive and rewarding social experiences are linked to conspecific identity through converging dorsal raphe 5-HT and paraventricular nucleus of the thalamus neurotensin signals in the vCA1 that instruct opposing valence, representing a synaptic switch for flexible social valence computation.

  • Julia M. Zorab
  • Huanhuan Li
  • Xiaoting Wu
ArticleOpen Access30 Apr 2025

entry.title: A battery-free nanofluidic intracellular delivery patch for internal organs (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
A battery-free nanofluidic intracellular delivery patch for internal organs

A nanofluidic intracellular delivery (NanoFLUID) patch provides a versatile, biocompatible and efficient method for the targeted delivery of payloads to internal organs for therapeutic purposes and for biomolecular investigations.

  • Dedong Yin
  • Pan Wang
  • Mo Li
Article30 Apr 2025

entry.title: An asymmetric fission island driven by shell effects in light fragments (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
An asymmetric fission island driven by shell effects in light fragments

Measurements of fission fragments for 100 fissioning systems are used to map an asymmetric fission island, providing evidence for the role played by the deformation induced by a closed 36-proton shell.

  • P. Morfouace
  • J. Taieb
  • M. Zhukov
Article30 Apr 2025

entry.title: Single-cell transcriptomics reveal how root tissues adapt to soil stress (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Single-cell transcriptomics reveal how root tissues adapt to soil stress

Single-cell RNA sequencing and spatial transcriptomic approaches reveal major expression changes in outer root cell types when grown in soil versus gel conditions, and also uncover how root tissues communicate and adapt to contrasting soil conditions at single-cell resolution.

  • Mingyuan Zhu
  • Che-Wei Hsu
  • Bipin K. Pandey
ArticleOpen Access30 Apr 2025

entry.title: Plant diversity dynamics over space and time in a warming Arctic (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Plant diversity dynamics over space and time in a warming Arctic

Warming temperatures and interactions between plants are the main drivers of changes in Arctic plant communities in response to climate change, and there is no evidence of overall biotic homogenization.

  • Mariana García Criado
  • Isla H. Myers-Smith
  • Mark Vellend
ArticleOpen Access30 Apr 2025
